titles.title: A bill to designate the Federal Building and United States Post Office located at 315 West Allegan Street in Lansing, Michigan, as the "Charles E. Chamberlain Federal Building and United States Post Office".

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Public Works and Transportation.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House by House Committee on Public Works and Transportation. Report No: 100-128.
Called up by House on Call of Consent Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Burdick without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 392.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Designates the Federal Building and United States Post Office located on West Allegan Street in Lansing, Michigan, as the Charles E. Chamberlain Federal Building and United States Post Office.
